poem:
"In the Hands of the Sphinx"

The bold Czech Sphinx,
turns his cast-iron gaze 
on the red mail-box,
old as the roses.

A £3.57bn clink,
a service, sold.

What will become,
of Royal in foreign helm,
and the humble postman's tread?

In the shadow of transaction,
await the echoes of change,
unseen yet, in the morning light.

A sale would". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
